info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 2:21AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greene, Craighead, central Poinsett, northwestern Mississippi, Clay, northwestern Cross, northwestern Pemiscot and Dunklin Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 220 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McDougal to near Jonesboro to 6 miles west of Cherry Valley. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jonesboro, Paragould, Kennett, Trumann, Malden, Piggott, Manila, Harrisburg, Lake City, Leachville, Campbell, Rector, Lepanto, Bay, Senath, Brookland, Monette, Caraway, Marmaduke and Chalk Bluff Natural Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
